channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Household rubbish dumped, 25th August
item.description:
A table, rug, plastic box, black sacks etc dumped by the recycling bins. An ongoing daily issue. I have reported to the Belvedere councillors to request fly tipping notices be installed and the Salvation Army bin be re-sited

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Park Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped white good (poss fridge) on pavement, 25th August
item.description:
Flytipped white good (poss fridge) on pavement This was in the front garden of the hmo @ 1 Lesney Park Road for several weeks and had now been dumped on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lesney Park Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Missed Food Waste Collection at Eastway, Aumbrey Apartments, 25th August
item.description:
Food waste bins have not been collected several times over the past few months. They are now full, causing strong odours and attracting flies. This is unhygienic and makes it very difficult for residents. Please ensure timely and consistent collections.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Questionable patriotic graffiti, 25th August
item.description:
Please can the council make a stance to get rid of graffiti such as this . The argument of the symbol being patriotic is very loaded in a multi racial area and we donâ€™t need symbols of exclusion, fear and prejudice. Even the indication that it can be divisive is enough ti show this is wrong , plus it is still graffiti!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-16, Woolwich Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin relocation - constant mess, 25th August
item.description:
The bin is repeatedly emptied by foxes resulting in the contents being strewn all over the road and pavement. Can this be moved? Otherwise it's pointless less having a bench there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Fellbrigg Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
